snippet: Mandatory life without parole still applies to some juveniles.
abstract: Editorial warns some states have refused to retroactively apply Supreme Court decision banning mandatory sentences of life without parole for juveniles; calls on states to resolve this arbitrary gap in justice, saying that juveniles are fundamentally less morally culpable than adults.
lead_paragraph: Mandatory life without parole still applies to some juveniles.
